{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=1966 |Team=Wyoming Cowboys |Image= |ImageSize = |Conference=Western Athletic Conference |Division= |ShortConference=WAC |Record=10-1 |ConfRecord=5-0 |CoachRank=15 |APRank=Not ranked |HeadCoach=[[Lloyd Eaton]] |OffCoach= |DefCoach= |OScheme= |DScheme= |Stadium=[[War Memorial Stadium (Wyoming)|War Memorial Stadium]] |Champion=WAC Champions |BowlTourney={{alternate links|1966 Sun Bowl|Sun Bowl|title=Sun Bowl}} |BowlTourneyResult= W, 28-20, {{cfb link|year=1966|team=Florida State Seminoles|title=Florida State}} }} The '''1966 [[Wyoming Cowboys football]] team''' represented the [[University of Wyoming]] in the 1966 NCAA football season. The Cowboys offense scored 355 points while the defense allowed 89 points. Led by head coach Lloyd Eaton, the Cowboys competed in the [[1966 Sun Bowl]]. The Cowboys had the nation's best rushing defense.<ref>http://www.wyomingathletics.com/trads/hof-1993.html</ref> ==Schedule==
